results.description:
CREEPY started in 1964 published by WARREN. It is classic black and white horror anthology comic that made it´s mascot/hoast character UNCLE CREEPY famous. The comic was first edited by Russ Jones (whose idea the magazine was) with Joe Orlando as a story editor. In year 1965 Archie Goodwin became the editor of CREEPY. Many famous artists worked for the magazine, including Frank Frazetta, Al Williamson and Wally Wood. CREEPY was published until 1983. Dark Horse started CREEPY again in 2009 with new material.

Collected Editions

  • Creepy Archives vol. 1 (#1-5)
  • Creepy Archives vol. 2 (#6-10)
  • Creepy Archives vol. 3 (#11-15)
  • Creepy Archives vol. 4 (#16-20)
